solution_line_template: Last year, Bob's salary was equal to three times Mario's salary this year, meaning Bob was earning {multiplier_for_bobs_last_year_salary}*${marios_salary_this_year} = $<<{multiplier_for_bobs_last_year_salary}*{marios_salary_this_year}={bobs_salary_last_year}>>{bobs_salary_last_year}

If Bob's salary increased by {increase_numerator}/{increase_denominator}% this year, he is earning {increase_numerator}/{increase_denominator}*${bobs_salary_last_year}= $<<{increase_numerator}/{increase_denominator}*{bobs_salary_last_year}={bobs_salary_increase}>>{bobs_salary_increase} more
Bob's total salary this year is ${bobs_salary_last_year}+${bobs_salary_increase}= $<<{bobs_salary_last_year}+{bobs_salary_increase}={bobs_current_salary}>>{bobs_current_salary}
